page.title: 15HOUSING IN WELSHPOOL
page.content: Most housing in Welshpool lies to the North, North-East and South of the town on estates of either owner occupied or council houses and flats. {The largest council estate is Olford, situated on the southern edge of the town, which consists of blocks of flats and about 400 houses. On the northern side of the town are the two other large council estates of {Woodside and Bron y Buckley}consisting of approximately 150 older houses each. The{owner occupied houses}lie on the estates of{Delwood, Red Bank, {Gungrog Hill and Borfa Green}on the north-eastern side of the town and consist of both detached and semi-detached houses most of which have been built since 1960. Many of these houses are bought through the four main estate agents in the town.
